ygData.subject: Re: twinked? / EQ ettiquette
ygData.msgSnippet: I m also high lvl and it only slightly bothers me.. just common curtosy to say hi is all I ask.. I even put it in my bio tho.. which says something like:  Hi!
ygData.messageBody:
I'm also high lvl and it only slightly bothers me.. just common curtosy to
say hi is all I ask.. I even put it in my bio tho.. which says something
like: "Hi! being nosey eh? I like to check out ppls stuff too but least
you can do is say hi! I don't bite.. well not hard anyway =P" so it's just
a joke.. but some even after reading that, some still take their looksie and
walk off.. oh well.. some ppl are just that way.. I don't give it more than
a 2 second thought or anything =) the majority ask where'd ya get this or
what's the stats on that.. or some simply say WOW! if I have time I always
am happy to talk about whatever I got and where cause I'm happy to have been
lucky enough to get those things =)

Roxi Dreamweaver
Lvl 50 Barb Shammie

----- Original Message -----
From: Jonathan <jpeck@...>
To: <EverQuest@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, February 07, 2000 3:22 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] twinked? / EQ ettiquette


> From: "Jonathan" <jpeck@...>
>
> Being a rather high level warrior.. I get inspected constantly by lowbies
> and I inspect/am inspected by people my level all the time. It in no way
> bothers me, and if it does, it just shows you're getting into the game a
> little too much. The only time this should ever make you feel uneasy is
if
> you're on a PvP server because they're scoping for your items to see if
they
> should kill you usually. If this honestly bothers you, I would imagine
you
> the type of person who is claustrophobic or who gets upset if someone
bumps
> into you in the subway or something along those lines. Eventually, you'll
> take it with an air of pride must likely, because it's usually just
newbies
> gawking over your equipment.
